title.narrative: Supporting the Most Vulnerable People Affected by COVID-19 in Haiti Through Immediate, Integrated Humanitarian Assistance, Haiti

description.narrative: IOM aims to support the Government of Haiti in providing urgent integrated humanitarian assistance for the benefit of the most vulnerable population affected by the COVID-19 crisis in Haiti, paving the way to longer-term structural measures. In order to do so, IOM will focus the intervention on reinforcement of the logistical and operational capacity of the National Ambulance Center (CAN, in French). Surveillance and referral system for early detection and monitoring of the evolution of the pandemic will also be reinforced at the border and in the 6 points of entry. In close coordination with Ministry of Public Health and Population (MSPP in French) and WHO, designated medical infrastructures will be repaired and adapted to respond to COVID-19. Communication activities to raise awareness on the epidemic, providing health advice on practices to avoid/limit transmission of the virus will be conducted as well.

participating-org.narrative: European Commission - Humanitarian Aid & Civil Protection

mailing-address.narrative: 11 Rue E. Pierre, Port-au-Prince TABARRE, Haiti

sector.narrative: Migr Health Assist for Crisis Aff Pops
